Pre-Game Insights: The Minnesota Timberwolves are 18-17 in Western Conference play, while the New Orleans Pelicans are 7-29, 15th in the Western Conference.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is scheduled for Tuesday, 8 p.m. EST in New Orleans.
The Timberwolves have a 15-10 record against Western Conference opponents, while the Pelicans are 3-17 in Western Conference games.
Others: Key players include Anthony Edwards for the Timberwolves and Yves Missi for the Pelicans.
The Pelicans rank fifth in the league with 12.4 offensive rebounds per game, led by Missi averaging 3.8 offensive boards.
The Timberwolves average 15.1 made 3-pointers per game, 1.0 more than the 14.1 allowed by the Pelicans.
